intro: Diplotaxis virgata var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth diplotaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in racemes, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance through its deep root system and reduced leaf surface area. This variant is distinguished by its glabrous (smooth) stems and leaves, setting it apart from other varieties within the species.
